column1: BBC News NI outlines the latest data on coronavirus and Covid-19 vaccinations across Northern Ireland and the Republic of Ireland.Eight more coronavirus-related deaths have been reported in Northern Ireland on Friday.Deaths are measured by recording those who died within 28 days of receiving a positive result in a test for coronavirus.The total number of deaths linked to Covid-19 in Northern Ireland since the start of the pandemic is 2
column3: 039 cases of coronavirus were reported on Friday
column5: 163 on Thursday.That includes cases confirmed from samples taken in recent days
column6: not necessarily just in the latest 24-hour reporting period.A total of 239
column7: 339 cases of the virus have been confirmed in Northern Ireland since the pandemic began.There are 342 patients with Covid-19 in hospitals
column8: which is unchanged from Thursday.The number of patients with Covid-19 in hospital intensive care units was 33 on Friday
column9: up from 29 on Thursday.Last updated 1 October at 14:45 BSTSource: Department of Health Northern IrelandA total of 2
